___ext.description: Replace any existing extension with this value in generated 'dest' paths.

___src.description: Pattern(s) to match, relative to the 'cwd'.

___cwd.description: All 'src' matches are relative to (but don't include) this path

___expand.description: Must be set to true to use properties other than 'src' and 'dest'

___extDot.description: Used to indicate where the period indicating the extension is located.

___filter.description: The 'filter' property can help you target files with a greater level of detail

___matchBase.description: If set, patterns without slashes will be matched against the basename of the path if it contains slashes. For example, 'a?b' would match the path '/xyz/123/acb', but not '/xyz/acb/123'.

___rename.description: This function is called for each matched 'src' file, (after extension renaming and flattening).

___nonull.description: If set to 'true' then the operation will include non-matching patterns. Combined with grunt's '--verbose' flag, this option can help debug file path issues.

___flatten.description: Remove all path parts from generated 'dest' paths

___jshintrc.description: Either a boolean value or a string containing the file name of the jshintrc file.

title: JSON schema for the Grunt JSHint task

___jshintrc.description: Either a boolean value or a string containing the file name of the jshintrc file.

$eref.title: JSON schema for JSHint configuration files

___expr.description: Suppresses warnings about the use of expressions where normally you would expect to see assignments or function calls

___futurehostile.description: Enables warnings about the use of identifiers which are defined in future versions of JavaScript

___supernew.description: Suppresses warnings about constructions like `new function () { ... };` and `new Object;`

___withstmt.description: Suppresses warnings about the use of the `with` statement

___noreturnawait.description: Async functions resolve on their return value. In most cases, this makes returning the result of an AwaitExpression (which is itself a Promise instance) unnecessary

___validthis.description: Suppresses warnings about possible strict violations when the code is running in strict mode and you use `this` in a non-constructor function

___boss.description: Suppresses warnings about the use of assignments in cases where comparisons are expected

___elision.description: Tells JSHint that your code uses ES3 array elision elements, or empty elements

___latedef.description: Prohibits the use of a variable before it was defined

___strict.description: Requires all code to run in ES5 strict mode

___maxerr.description: Maximum amount of warnings JSHint will produce before giving up

___trailingcomma.description: Warns when a comma is not placed after the last element in an array or object literal

___singleGroups.description: Prohibits the use of the grouping operator when it is not strictly required.

___moz.description: Tells JSHint that your code uses Mozilla JavaScript extensions

___globals.description: Specify a white list of global variables that are not formally defined in the source code

additionalProperties.description: Name of the global. Set to `true` for read/write, `false` for read-only.

___freeze.description: Prohibits overwriting prototypes of native objects such as Array, Date and so on

___unused.description: Warns when you define and never use your variables

___shelljs.description: [Environment] Defines globals exposed by the ShellJS library

___varstmt.description: Forbids the use of VariableStatements (`var`) in favor of `let` and `const`

___bitwise.description: Prohibit the use of bitwise operators (&, |, ^, etc.)

___overrides.description: Specify the options that should only be applied to files matching a given path pattern

additionalProperties.description: The path pattern to apply the given options to

___scripturl.description: Suppresses warnings about the use of script-targeted URLs

___shadow.description: Suppresses warnings about variable shadowing. i.e. declaring a variable that had been already declared somewhere in the outer scope

___extends.description: Specify the path to another configuration file to use as a base, relative to the current file

___maxparams.description: Max number of formal parameters allowed per function

___regexpu.description: Enables warnings for regular rexpressions which do not include the 'u' flag

___lastsemic.description: Suppresses warnings about missing semicolons, but only when the semicolon is omitted for the last statement in a one-line block

___nocomma.description: Prohibits the use of the comma operator

___forin.description: Requires all `for in` loops to filter object's items with obj.hasOwnProperty()

___evil.description: Suppresses warnings about the use of `eval`

___eqeqeq.description: Prohibits the use of `==` and `!=` in favor of `===` and `!==`

___curly.description: Requires you to always put curly braces around blocks in loops and conditionals

___funcscope.description: Suppresses warnings about declaring variables inside of control structures while accessing them later from the outside

___noyield.description: Suppresses warnings about generator functions with no `yield` statement in them

___esversion.description: The ECMAScript version to which the code must adhere

___undef.description: Prohibits the use of explicitly undeclared variables

___debug.description: Suppresses warnings about the `debugger` statements in your code

___typed.description: [Environment] Defines globals for typed array constructors

___loopfunc.description: Suppresses warnings about functions inside of loops

___nonew.description: Prohibits the use of constructors for side-effects (without assignment)

___jshintrc.description: Either a boolean value or a string containing the file name of the jshintrc file.
